# Reference

## Table of Contents

### Classes

#### Private Classes

* `patch::cache`: patch cache support
* `patch::default`: patch defined type defaults and system setup
* `patch::package`: manage required packages

### Defined types

* [`patch`](#patch): Apply patch to a target path

## Defined types

### <a name="patch"></a>`patch`

Apply patch to a target path

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
patch { 'patch vendor templates':
  target  => '/opt/application/templates',
  content => file("${module_name}/vendor.patch"),
  strip   => 1,
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `patch` defined type:

* [`target`](#-patch--target)
* [`content`](#-patch--content)
* [`source`](#-patch--source)
* [`strip`](#-patch--strip)
* [`loose`](#-patch--loose)
* [`backup`](#-patch--backup)

##### <a name="-patch--target"></a>`target`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

directory where the patch will be applied

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-patch--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

text of a unified diff

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-patch--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

unified diff file

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-patch--strip"></a>`strip`

Data type: `Integer`

strip the smallest prefix containing num leading slashes from each file name in the patch file

Default value: `0`

##### <a name="-patch--loose"></a>`loose`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

match patterns loosely, in case tabs or spaces have been munged in your files

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-patch--backup"></a>`backup`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

create backups of successfully patched files

Default value: `undef`
